result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott G. Starfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

9:10  Bailiffs are Sue Gulbranson and Diane Wiskechen.  Defendant Scott G. Starfield in court with attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson. Sean Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 20 jurors are seated.  The judge calls the case and does general voir dire of the panel.  Atty Froelich voir dires the panel.  Atty Harrelson voir dires the panel  The attorneys make 4 strikes each.  12 jurors are selected and sworn. 10:21 Jury is excused for 15 min.   10:41 The court resumes.  Judge gives the jury the preliminary instruction.  Atty Froelich gives his opening statement.  Atty Harrelson gives opening statement.  Officer Kristopher STewart is sw and ex by Froelich. Exh # 1 Photo of metal snus can.  Exh #2 Photo of the snus can. Exh 3 3 Photos of the snus can with ruler beside it.  Exh # 4 Photo of snus tin with the cover removed.  Exh #5 Photo of the blue gem bag with the meth inside. Exh # 6 Snus can in the evidence bag.   Exh 1,2,3,4,5,6 are offered and received.   Atty Harrelson x-exams.   12:02  The jury is excused for lunch.  The attorneys and defendant are present. The Judge addresses what Officer Schladweiler's testimony would be.  The Judge reviews with the attorneys what they would show with it. The Judges feels that the testimony is not relevant. Atty Harrelson gives argument. Atty Froelich responds.  The Judge states his ruling stands. 12:11  Recess for lunch. 1:27  Attys defendant are present. Atty Harrelson addresses the defendants position for the crime labe witnesses appearing by telephone. 1:36 The Jury returns to the courtroom.  Officer Jesse Neely is sw and ex by Atty Froelich.  Witness ID's the defendant.  Atty Harrelson x-exams.    Catherine Kohl from WI State Crime Lab  is sw and ex by Atty Froelich  Exh #7 Supplementak report wrote by Cathering Kohl  off & Rec  Exh # 8 Report 10-8-2016 by Catherine Kohl  off & Rec. Atty Harrelson x-exams.  Martin Koch is sw and ex by Atty Froelich, Exh # 9 Copy of report preared by Martin Koch on  10-21-2016 Exh 9 offered and received. Atty Harrelson x-exams.  Atty Froelich re-directs.  State rests.  The jury is excused 2:49  The attorneys and defendant are present.  Atty Froelich makes a record on what was discussed in the side bar previously held. Atty Harrelson makes a motion to dismiss. The court denies the motion to dismiss.  Recess for 10 minutes. 2:55    3:13 Court resumes with the attorneys and the defendant present.  The Judge reviews the defendant's right to testify with him.  3:18  The Jury returns to the courtroom.  Scott Starfield is sw and ex by Atty Harrelson. Atty Froelich x-exams. Atty Harrelson re-directs. Atty Froelich re-x-exams.The defense rests.   Atty Froelich recalls Officer Stewart and exams him. The state rests.  The Jury is excused for today. 3:59  Recess for 10 -15 minutes. 4:10  Attys and defendant present instruction and verdict conference.  6030, 140, 145,170,180,157, 157, 190, 195,300,160,465,484,515,4:21  recess   Court will begin at 8:30 tomorrow.
9:02   The Attorneys, defendant, and jury are present.  The Judge instructs the jury. 9:19 Atty Froelich gives closing argument. 9:40  Atty Harrelson gives his closing. 10:08 Froelich gives his final argument.  Judge reads his final insturctions to the jury. 10:34 The bailiffs are sw and the jury is excused to deliberate. Exhibits will not go to the jury unless they request them.  10:40   12:00  The jury has a question - attorneys and defendant are present. The Judge has a response wrote out and the attorneys agree. 12:01     12:45  Jury returns with a verdict.  
Guilty of poss of Meth Ct 1. 
Guilty of poss of THC Ct 2.
Judge polls the jury. 12:48 Jury is excused.  The Judge enters judgment of conviction on Ct 1 & 2 based on the verdict of the jury.  REcess 12:51

8:34  In the East Courtroom. Jury not present.  Defendant Scott G. Starfield in court with attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin  The Judge addresses courtroom procedure with the attorneys.  Witness list are reviewed.  Crime lab witnesses will be by video conference.  Froelich requests that  Officer Chris Stewart be allowed in the courtroom as court officer. Court grants that request. Motions for unlawful arrest, improper miranda, and unlawful search of the vehicle. Motion to admit evidence of 3rd party cupability. Motion to suppress evidence seized by unlawful arrest.  Miranda issue regardings statements made not in answer to any questions asked of him at the immediate time of arrest and the statements made in the jail. . Court rules all are admissable.  Motion regarding search of the vehicle. 3rd party cupablility Judge does not find anything that would connect the 3rd parties to this crime for either charge. This motion is denied. Atty Froelich addresses  Officer Schladweiler's testifmony is admissable. Atty Harrelson responds. The court will have the Officer be questioned outside the presence of the jury.9:09
